text: There are lots of Julia packages that seem well suited to noisy optimisation (as in SMM) including Optim (with simulated annealing), BlackBoxOptim, GalacticOptim, Surrogates, SurrogateModelOptim, GaussianProcesses. If you have a large vector of prices, iterating over the price vector with the update a function of excess demand seems to work well in a lot of applications (example here <https://s3.amazonaws.com/real.stlouisfed.org/wp/2017/2017-005.pdf> ), rather than using penalty/barrier functions.

text: I guess surrogates more for slow, rather than noisy, although normally with SMM you can choose either slow or noisy measurements.
